page.title: 01NEWTON HALL/FRAMWELLGATEMOOR
page.content: NEWTON HALL/FRAMWELLGATE MOOR Framwellgate Moor is the surface of a glacial delta. This area,together with Newton Hall,is a dormitory settlement for Durham City. Newton Hall is one of the largest private housing estates in Europe. The estate is close to the A1(M) and main roads to Sunderland and Newcastle. The Durham County Fire Brigade Headquarters is situated at Framwellgate Moor and a new prison, Frankland, is located on the fringe of Newton Hall. It was designed to hold high risk prisoners. The following are within a short distance of Framwellgate Moor:- Dryburn General Hospital, County Hall - the administrative headquarters for the County, New College - the result of a merger between Durham Technical College and Neville's Cross College.
